perturbation.original_text: All such message campaigns will comply with Excite's then current privacy policy which is located at http://www.excite.com/privacy_policy and is subject to change from time to time. If the privacy policy changes in a manner that has a material adverse effect on the value, functionality or implementation of the DeliverE message campaign for Client, Excite will notify Client, which will then have the option to cancel future DeliverE campaigns and both parties will be relieved of their obligations related to those canceled DeliverE campaigns, if Client, in its sole but reasonable discretion, finds such changed privacy policy objectionable.
perturbation.changed_text: All such message campaigns will generally align with Excite's privacy practices, which may evolve. If the privacy approach shifts and arguably affects the DeliverE message campaign, Excite will inform Client, who may consider adjusting future campaigns, and both parties will re-evaluate their obligations if Client vaguely expresses concerns about the privacy approach.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces significant ambiguity. Replacing 'comply' with 'generally align' weakens the obligation to adhere strictly to the privacy policy. 'May evolve' makes future changes uncertain. 'Arguably affects' introduces subjectivity in determining impact. 'Vaguely expresses concerns' replaces a clear 'objectionable' standard with an ambiguous one, making it difficult to enforce the client's right to cancel. This could violate California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) requirements for clear and affirmative consent for data processing, as well as GDPR regulations if data of EU residents are involved.
perturbation.contradicted_law: CCPA (California Consumer Privacy Act) and GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation)

perturbation.original_text: Client will not use User Data to specifically target any Excite and/or WebCrawler users, as distinct from all users of the Client Site, for solicitations (except as specifically provided in this Agreement), either individually or in the aggregate, during the term of this Agreement and for a period of twelve (12) months following the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Client will endeavor to avoid specifically targeting Excite and/or WebCrawler users, as distinct from all users of the Client Site, for overt solicitations (except as specifically provided in this Agreement), either individually or in the aggregate, during the term of this Agreement and for a period of approximately twelve (12) months following the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'will not use' is replaced with 'will endeavor to avoid', making the obligation less strict and more of a suggestion. 'Overt solicitations' adds ambiguity regarding what constitutes an 'overt' solicitation versus a subtle marketing tactic. 'Approximately twelve (12) months' introduces vagueness to the duration of the restriction. This creates uncertainty and potential non-compliance with consumer data privacy regulations, such as the CCPA, which requires clear limitations on the use of personal information.

perturbation.original_text:
Client will indemnify, defend and hold harmless Excite, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants and agents from any and all third party claims, liability, damages and/or costs (including, but not limited to, attorneys fees) arising from:
i) Its breach of any representation or covenant in this Agreement; or
ii) Any claim that Client's Impression Material infringes or violates any third party's copyright, patent, trade secret, trademark, right of publicity or right of privacy or contain any defamatory content; or
iii) Any claim that Client's Impression Material and/or its display on the Excite Network violates any federal, state or local laws, regulations or statutes, including but not limited to restrictions on the sale, advertisement or promotion of vitamins, nutritional supplements, drugs or other health-related products; or
iv) Any claim of personal injury or product liability with respect to products or services sold, advertised or otherwise offered to consumers or third parties through display of Client's Impression Material on the Excite Network or links to the Client Site; or
v) Any claim arising from content displayed on the Client Site.
Excite will promptly notify Client of any and all such claims and will reasonably cooperate with Client with the defense and/or settlement thereof; provided that, if any settlement requires an affirmative obligation of, results in any ongoing liability to or prejudices or detrimentally impacts Excite in any way and such obligation, liability, prejudice or impact can reasonably be expected to be material, then such settlement shall require Excite's written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed) and Excite may have its own counsel in attendance at all proceedings and substantive negotiations relating to such claim.
perturbation.changed_text: Client will, to a reasonable extent, indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Excite, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants, and agents from third-party claims, liabilities, damages, and costs (potentially including attorney's fees) arising from: i) A notable breach of a key representation or covenant in this Agreement; or ii) A significant claim that Client's Impression Material severely infringes a third party's core intellectual property rights, such as copyright or trademark, or contains highly defamatory content; or iii) A major claim that Client's Impression Material and/or its display on the Excite Network directly violates specific federal or state laws expressly restricting the sale, advertisement, or promotion of certain health-related products; or iv) A substantial claim of serious personal injury or egregious product liability directly linked to products or services prominently displayed via Client's Impression Material on the Excite Network or links to the Client Site; or v) A noteworthy claim arising from clearly unlawful content displayed on the Client Site. Excite will generally inform Client of considerable claims and aim to cooperate reasonably with the defense or settlement, provided that if a settlement clearly obligates or noticeably impacts Excite negatively in any serious way, it will require thoughtful consideration by Excite.
perturbation.explanation: The changes weaken the indemnification clause through the introduction of subjective and ambiguous qualifiers. 'To a reasonable extent' limits the scope of indemnification. Modifying 'any' to 'notable', 'significant', 'major', 'substantial', and 'noteworthy' adds subjective thresholds for triggering indemnification obligations. Changing 'attorney's fees' to 'potentially including attorney's fees' makes it discretionary. The phrase 'clearly obligates or noticeably impacts Excite negatively in any serious way' is also subjective, making it more difficult for Excite to enforce the indemnification. This weakens consumer protection and product liability provisions, potentially conflicting with state laws on product liability and false advertising.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State laws on product liability and false advertising.
